abstract.p: Letter from Theresa Loar, director of President's Interagency Council on Women, replies to Aug 30 letter from Jessica Neuwirth, president of Equality Now, citing ways in which Pres Clinton underscored United States support for progress of women and girls in Nigeria

block.p: Contrary to the assertion by Jessica Neuwirth, the president of Equality Now (letter, Aug. 30), that President Clinton did not place a high priority on the plight of women during his visit to Nigeria, the president underscored our government's support for the progress of women and girls in Nigeria in several ways.

Contrary to the assertion by Jessica Neuwirth, the president of Equality Now (letter, Aug. 30), that President Clinton did not place a high priority on the plight of women during his visit to Nigeria, the president underscored our government's support for the progress of women and girls in Nigeria in several ways.

During a keynote address to the Nigerian National Assembly, he commended Nigeria for starting Vital Voices Nigeria, a project to support Nigerian women and the crucial role they play in building democracy.

At a women's center in Abuja, President Clinton emphasized the importance of meeting women's health needs, particularly addressing the AIDS-H.I.V. pandemic and its effect on African women and their families.
As part of the president's trip, more than $2 million was announced in new programs for women's nongovernmental organizations, grassroots political training and girls' education.
THERESA LOAR Director, President's Interagency Council on Women Washington, Sept. 5, 2000
